meanings.definition: To hit a golf ball gently with a putter.
meanings.sent1: He putted the ball into the hole with precision.
meanings.sent2: She putted the golf ball towards the flag.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel putted the acorn into the hole, thinking it was a golf ball.
meanings.sent4: The sun putted its rays through the clouds, creating a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The child putted the puzzle pieces together to complete the picture.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she putted the book back on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He putted the keys on the table before leaving.
meanings.sent3: The cat putted the toy mouse under the bed, pretending it was a real catch.
meanings.sent4: The moon putted a soft glow over the sleeping town.
meanings.sent5: The chef putted the final touch on the dish before serving it.
